trans-unit.source: Summary of Table Service Functionality
trans-unit.target: Summary of Table Service Functionality

trans-unit.source: The Table service REST API is compliant with the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>, with some differences, as described in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: The Table service REST API is compliant with the <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol Specification</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>, with some differences, as described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Table Service Extensions
trans-unit.target: Table Service Extensions

trans-unit.source: Table Service Restrictions
trans-unit.target: Table Service Restrictions

trans-unit.source: Table Service Extensions
trans-unit.target: Table Service Extensions

trans-unit.source: The Table service extends the functionality of OData in the following ways.
trans-unit.target: The Table service extends the functionality of OData in the following ways.

trans-unit.source: Shared Key and Shared Key Lite Authentication
trans-unit.target: Shared Key and Shared Key Lite Authentication

trans-unit.source: The Table service requires that each request be authenticated.
trans-unit.target: The Table service requires that each request be authenticated.

trans-unit.source: Both Shared Key and Shared Key Lite authentication are supported.
trans-unit.target: Both Shared Key and Shared Key Lite authentication are supported.

trans-unit.source: Shared Key authentication is more secure and is recommended for requests made against the Table service using the REST API.
trans-unit.target: Shared Key authentication is more secure and is recommended for requests made against the Table service using the REST API.

trans-unit.source: For more information about authenticating requests, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about authenticating requests, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Continuation Tokens for Query Pagination
trans-unit.target: Continuation Tokens for Query Pagination

trans-unit.source: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 items at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.
trans-unit.target: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 items at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the result set contains more than 1,000 items, or if the query did not complete within five seconds, the response includes headers which provide the developer with continuation tokens to use in order to resume the query at the next item in the result set.
trans-unit.target: If the result set contains more than 1,000 items, or if the query did not complete within five seconds, the response includes headers which provide the developer with continuation tokens to use in order to resume the query at the next item in the result set.

trans-unit.source: Continuation token headers may be returned for a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Tables</link> operation or a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Entities</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Continuation token headers may be returned for a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Tables</link> operation or a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Entities</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Note that the total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.
trans-unit.target: Note that the total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.

trans-unit.source: For more information about continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.

trans-unit.source: Primary Key System Properties
trans-unit.target: Primary Key System Properties

trans-unit.source: Every entity in the Table service has two key properties: the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property and the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: Every entity in the Table service has two key properties: the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property and the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: These properties together form the table's primary key and uniquely identify each entity in the table.
trans-unit.target: These properties together form the table's primary key and uniquely identify each entity in the table.

trans-unit.source: Both properties require string values.
trans-unit.target: Both properties require string values.

trans-unit.source: It is the developer's responsibility to provide values for these properties when a new entity is inserted, and to include them in any update or delete operation on an entity.
trans-unit.target: It is the developer's responsibility to provide values for these properties when a new entity is inserted, and to include them in any update or delete operation on an entity.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these required key properties, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these required key properties, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: Timestamp System Property
trans-unit.target: Timestamp System Property

trans-unit.source: Every entity in the Table service has a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> system property.
trans-unit.target: Every entity in the Table service has a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> system property.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value that is maintained on the server side to record the time an entity was last modified.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property is a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DateTime</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> value that is maintained on the server side to record the time an entity was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The Table service uses the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property internally to provide optimistic concurrency.
trans-unit.target: The Table service uses the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property internally to provide optimistic concurrency.

trans-unit.source: The value of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a monotonically increasing value, meaning that each time the entity is modified, the value of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> increases for that entity.
trans-unit.target: The value of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> is a monotonically increasing value, meaning that each time the entity is modified, the value of <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> increases for that entity.

trans-unit.source: This property should not be set on insert or update operations (the value will be ignored).
trans-unit.target: This property should not be set on insert or update operations (the value will be ignored).

trans-unit.source: For more information about the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> property, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: Batch Operations
trans-unit.target: Batch Operations

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports batch transactions on entities that are in the same table and belong to the same partition group, which means they have the same <parameterReference>PartitionKey</parameterReference> value.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports batch transactions on entities that are in the same table and belong to the same partition group, which means they have the same <parameterReference>PartitionKey</parameterReference> value.

trans-unit.source: This allows multiple insert, update, merge, and delete operations to be supported within a single atomic transaction.
trans-unit.target: This allows multiple insert, update, merge, and delete operations to be supported within a single atomic transaction.

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports a subset of the functionality provided by the <externalLink><linkText>OData protocol</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports a subset of the functionality provided by the <externalLink><linkText>OData protocol</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about batch operations, see <link xlink:href="b10963c6-ced3-4fcc-abee-58a9e1c2b83a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Performing Entity Group Transactions</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about batch operations, see <link xlink:href="b10963c6-ced3-4fcc-abee-58a9e1c2b83a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Performing Entity Group Transactions</link>.

trans-unit.source: Table Service Restrictions
trans-unit.target: Table Service Restrictions

trans-unit.source: The Table service has the following restrictions on functionality provided by OData.
trans-unit.target: The Table service has the following restrictions on functionality provided by OData.

trans-unit.source: Credentials Property
trans-unit.target: Credentials Property

trans-unit.source: The Table service does not support using the <externalLink><linkText>Credentials</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=154550</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <externalLink><linkText>DataServiceContext</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=151839</linkUri></externalLink> class to authenticate a request.
trans-unit.target: The Table service does not support using the <externalLink><linkText>Credentials</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=154550</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <externalLink><linkText>DataServiceContext</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=151839</linkUri></externalLink> class to authenticate a request.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must authenticate a request against the Table service by adding an <parameterReference>Authorization</parameterReference> header to the request.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you must authenticate a request against the Table service by adding an <parameterReference>Authorization</parameterReference> header to the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Property Types
trans-unit.target: Property Types

trans-unit.source: Not all property types supported by the OData are supported by the Table service.
trans-unit.target: Not all property types supported by the OData are supported by the Table service.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported property types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported property types, see <link xlink:href="01f78ed1-9cbd-4b00-8113-71129751357e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Understanding the Table Service Data Model</link>.

trans-unit.source: Operations on Links
trans-unit.target: Operations on Links

trans-unit.source: The Table service does not currently support links between tables.
trans-unit.target: The Table service does not currently support links between tables.

trans-unit.source: Links are associative relationships between data.
trans-unit.target: Links are associative relationships between data.

trans-unit.source: Operations on Select Properties
trans-unit.target: Operations on Select Properties

trans-unit.source: Projection refers to querying a subset of the properties for an entity or entities.
trans-unit.target: Projection refers to querying a subset of the properties for an entity or entities.

trans-unit.source: It is analogous to selecting a subset of the columns or properties of a table when querying in LINQ.
trans-unit.target: It is analogous to selecting a subset of the columns or properties of a table when querying in LINQ.

trans-unit.source: Projection reduces the amount of data that must be returned by a query by specifying that only certain properties are returned in the response.
trans-unit.target: Projection reduces the amount of data that must be returned by a query by specifying that only certain properties are returned in the response.

trans-unit.source: Projection is supported as part of the 2011-08-18 version of the Azure storage services.
trans-unit.target: Projection is supported as part of the 2011-08-18 version of the Azure storage services.

trans-unit.source: For more information, refer to <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>, and <externalLink><linkText>OData: Select System Query Option ($select)</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, refer to <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities (REST API)</link>, <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>, and <externalLink><linkText>OData: Select System Query Option ($select)</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: LINQ Query Operators
trans-unit.target: LINQ Query Operators

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports using language-integrated queries (LINQ).
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports using language-integrated queries (LINQ).

trans-unit.source: Only these LINQ query operators are supported for use with the Table service:
trans-unit.target: Only these LINQ query operators are supported for use with the Table service:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators Supported for the Table Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators Supported for the Table Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: LINQ Comparison Operators
trans-unit.target: LINQ Comparison Operators

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports using a subset of the comparison operators provided by LINQ.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports using a subset of the comparison operators provided by LINQ.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link> and <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link> and <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.

trans-unit.source: GetMetadataURI Method
trans-unit.target: GetMetadataURI Method

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports the <externalLink><linkText>GetMetadataURI</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.services.client.dataservicecontext.getmetadatauri.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> method of the <externalLink><linkText>DataServiceContext</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.services.client.dataservicecontext.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> class, but it does not return any schema information beyond the three fixed schema properties.
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports the <externalLink><linkText>GetMetadataURI</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.services.client.dataservicecontext.getmetadatauri.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> method of the <externalLink><linkText>DataServiceContext</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.data.services.client.dataservicecontext.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> class, but it does not return any schema information beyond the three fixed schema properties.

trans-unit.source: These properties are <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: These properties are <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>PartitionKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>RowKey</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>, and <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Timestamp</unmanagedCodeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: JSON Format
trans-unit.target: JSON Format

trans-unit.source: OData supports sending payloads in the JSON format.
trans-unit.target: OData supports sending payloads in the JSON format.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Table service supports the OData JSON format as of API version 2013-08-15, with the OData data service version set to 3.0; prior versions do not support the JSON format.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Table service supports the OData JSON format as of API version 2013-08-15, with the OData data service version set to 3.0; prior versions do not support the JSON format.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9f1dce4a-d528-40ec-a5a4-fd93f9ee4c5e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload Format for Table Service Operations</link> and <link xlink:href="086d4db0-0743-4987-b8a7-2cd15090dfd6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9f1dce4a-d528-40ec-a5a4-fd93f9ee4c5e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload Format for Table Service Operations</link> and <link xlink:href="086d4db0-0743-4987-b8a7-2cd15090dfd6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting the OData Data Service Version Headers</link>.
